results.name: If n is semiprime (or 2-almost prime) then 1 else 0.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65545 (first 10000 terms from Reinhard Zumkeller)
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Prime zeta function primezeta(s).
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
formula: a(n) = 1 iff n is in A001358 (semiprimes), a(n) = 0 iff n is in A100959 (non-semiprimes). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 24 2004
Dirichlet g.f.: (primezeta(2s) + primezeta(s)^2)/2. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jun 09 2006
a(n) = A010051(A032742(n)) (i.e., largest proper divisor is prime). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 13 2011
results.author: _Patrick De Geest_, Oct 13 2001
